title.narrative: ELSAM - Mainstreaming UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights in Managing Tourism Industry in Indonesia

description.narrative:
The program aims at mainstreaming UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights to stakeholders of tourism in Indonesia by enabling human rights values as the guidance in managing tourism industry.
ELSAM will conduct activities with the outcomes as follows: Research in 4 areas to produce reports; National Seminar to increase the awareness of the stakeholders; Multi stakeholder dialogue to establish a common understanding between government, corporations, and CSO on BHR in tourism; and Workshop/Series of coordination meetings with RANHAM Joint Secretariat to accommodate the tourism issues into national action plan on human rights (RANHAM). The program is expected to produce a collaboration and synergy among stakeholders in developing policy in the tourism industry that adheres to human rights principles through the Human Rights National Action Plan (RANHAM) 2020-2024, which will be released in early 2020.
RANHAM is a document that includes the goals, strategies, and priority activities for human rights in Indonesia, which will be used as a reference for all relevant stakeholders in implementing human rights principles in Indonesia.
